description: Describes the stale security group rules for security groups referenced across a VPC peering connection, transit gateway connection, or with a security group VPC association. Rules are stale when they reference a deleted security group. Rules can also be stale if they reference a security group in a peer VPC for which the VPC peering connection has been deleted, across a transit gateway where the transit gateway has been deleted (or the transit gateway security group referencing feature has been disabled), or if a security group VPC association has been disassociated.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to include in another request to get the next page of items. This value is null when there are no more items to return.

nested_items.name: StaleSecurityGroupSet
nested_items.description: Information about the stale security groups.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the security group.

nested_items.name: GroupId
nested_items.description: The ID of the security group.

nested_items.name: GroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the security group.

nested_items.name: StaleIpPermissions
nested_items.description: Information about the stale inbound rules in the security group.

nested_items.name: FromPort
nested_items.description: If the protocol is TCP or UDP, this is the start of the port range. If the protocol is ICMP or ICMPv6, this is the ICMP type or -1 (all ICMP types).

nested_items.name: IpProtocol
nested_items.description: The IP protocol name ( tcp, udp, icmp, icmpv6) or number (see Protocol Numbers).

nested_items.name: IpRanges
nested_items.description: The IP ranges. Not applicable for stale security group rules.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: PrefixListIds
nested_items.description: The prefix list IDs. Not applicable for stale security group rules.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ToPort
nested_items.description: If the protocol is TCP or UDP, this is the end of the port range. If the protocol is ICMP or ICMPv6, this is the ICMP code or -1 (all ICMP codes).

nested_items.name: UserIdGroupPairs
nested_items.description: The security group pairs. Returns the ID of the referenced security group and VPC, and the ID and status of the VPC peering connection.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description for the security group rule that references this user ID group pair.

nested_items.name: UserId
nested_items.description: The ID of an Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: GroupName
nested_items.description: [Default VPC] The name of the security group. For a security group in a nondefault VPC, use the security group ID.

nested_items.name: GroupId
nested_items.description: The ID of the security group.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC for the referenced security group, if applicable.

nested_items.name: VpcPeeringConnectionId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC peering connection, if applicable.

nested_items.name: PeeringStatus
nested_items.description: The status of a VPC peering connection, if applicable.

nested_items.name: StaleIpPermissionsEgress
nested_items.description: Information about the stale outbound rules in the security group.

nested_items.name: FromPort
nested_items.description: If the protocol is TCP or UDP, this is the start of the port range. If the protocol is ICMP or ICMPv6, this is the ICMP type or -1 (all ICMP types).

nested_items.name: IpProtocol
nested_items.description: The IP protocol name ( tcp, udp, icmp, icmpv6) or number (see Protocol Numbers).

nested_items.name: IpRanges
nested_items.description: The IP ranges. Not applicable for stale security group rules.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: PrefixListIds
nested_items.description: The prefix list IDs. Not applicable for stale security group rules.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ToPort
nested_items.description: If the protocol is TCP or UDP, this is the end of the port range. If the protocol is ICMP or ICMPv6, this is the ICMP code or -1 (all ICMP codes).

nested_items.name: UserIdGroupPairs
nested_items.description: The security group pairs. Returns the ID of the referenced security group and VPC, and the ID and status of the VPC peering connection.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description for the security group rule that references this user ID group pair.

nested_items.description: The ID of an Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.description: [Default VPC] The name of the security group. For a security group in a nondefault VPC, use the security group ID.
